ویٹ فولڈنگ تکنیک زیادہ مجسماتی اور اظہار: What is wet folding technique in origami? Benefits of wet folding technique in origami

Wet-folding is an origami technique developed by Akira Yoshizawa that employs water to dampen the paper so that it can be manipulated more easily. This process adds an element of sculpture to origami, which is otherwise purely geometric.
What is wet folding technique in origami? Benefits of wet folding technique in origami

Wet-folding gives the paper works a more realistic appearance, adds a rounded quality to the origami, and allows it to appear malleable even though the pieces dry into hardened forms. Wet-folding also involves using a thicker paper, as traditional origami paper would easily tear if wet.
